availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph S. Wallingford (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and councilman)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and councilman. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Thornton Wallingford and Malinda Hull Wallingford. Married to Helen E. Morrison Wallingford in Fleming County, Kentucky, on October 5, 1848. Father of Joseph Wallingford, James Wallingford, John Wallingford, Charles Wallingford, Raleigh Wallingford, Helen Wallingford, Lee Wallingford, and Lizzie Wallingford. Farmer in Mason County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Mason County in 1850. Farmer in Mason County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Member of the Maysville Board of Council in Mason County in 1864.
